content:
Qartaba
Qartaba (Arabic: قرطبا‎, also spelled kartaba) is a village in the Jbeil District of the Mount Lebanon Governorate, Lebanon. It is located 54 kilometers north Beirut on the mountains above Byblos at an altitude of 1,250 meters.{"citetype": "web", "title": "Kartaba", "publisher": "Linking Lebanon", "accessdate": "2007-12-08"} The town has large church square, and is surrounded by olive groves, mulberry orchards, and vineyards.{"citetype": "book", "date": "2001", "title": "Syria & Lebanon Handbook: The Travel Guide", "publisher": "Footprint Travel Guides", "page": "502", "author": "Ivan Mannheim"} In Syriac, Qartaba means "good, curing and balanced weather".

History
Qartaba was once considered an important village in the Jbeil highland, a trade point for surrounding villages.{"citetype": "web", "title": "Kartaba", "publisher": "Linking Lebanon", "accessdate": "2007-12-08"} Silk manufacturing flourished and in 1918, seven factories employed more than 500 people and much of the silk was exported to Lyon, France.{"citetype": "web", "title": "Kartaba", "publisher": "Linking Lebanon", "accessdate": "2007-12-08"}

Demographics
The inhabitants of Qartaba are predominantly Maronite Catholics.{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://www.localiban.org/IMG/pdf/Elections_municipales_libanaises_2010_-_Mont-Liban.pdf", "title": "Elections municipales et ikhtiariah au Mont-Liban", "date": "2010", "website": "Localiban", "publisher": "Localiban", "page": "19", "format": "pdf", "accessdate": "2016-02-12", "urlstatus": "dead", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20150724081015/http://www.localiban.org/IMG/pdf/Elections_municipales_libanaises_2010_-_Mont-Liban.pdf"} The families of the village include Sakr, Challita, Saad, El-Sokhn, Karam, Beyrouthy (El Kassis), El-Khoury, Acar, Gharios, Cherfane, Atallah, Francis and Salem.[citation needed]
